main_definition: Outside refers to the external or outer part of something, often used in contexts involving physical space or boundaries.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The exterior side or area outside a boundary or structure.
meanings_and_examples.example: I'll wait for you on the outside step.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not within an establishment, e.g., not inside a building.
meanings_and_examples.example: There are no toilets outside this restaurant; we have to walk to the next one.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to describe something happening in public or accessible by everyone.
meanings_and_examples.example: The park is open for visitors, so you can enjoy it outside your home.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not involved with a particular activity or group; not part of the inside circle.
meanings_and_examples.example: He felt left out because he wasn't included in the decision-making process and was always on the outside.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The external surface area, especially that which is exposed to the environment.
meanings_and_examples.example: Cleaning the exterior of the house every week helps keep it looking fresh and inviting.
